DataElement.preferredName: Patient Self-Report Adrenal Gland Pheochromocytoma Occurrence Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no subjective response regarding whether a patient has a benign or malignant neuroendocrine neoplasm of the sympathetic nervous system that secretes catecholamines arising from the chromaffin cells of the adrenal medulla.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Self-Report Adrenal Gland Pheochromocytoma Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Subjective reports made by the patient_A benign or malignant neuroendocrine neoplasm of the sympathetic nervous system that secretes catecholamines.  It arises from the chromaffin cells of the adrenal medulla.  Clinical presentation includes headaches, palpitations, chest and abdominal pain, hypertension, fever, and tremor.  Microscopically, a characteristic nesting (zellballen) growth pattern is usually seen.  Other growth patterns including trabecular pattern may also be present._Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Subjective reports made by the patient:A benign or malignant neuroendocrine neoplasm of the sympathetic nervous system that secretes catecholamines.  It arises from the chromaffin cells of the adrenal medulla.  Clinical presentation includes headaches, palpitations, chest and abdominal pain, hypertension, fever, and tremor.  Microscopically, a characteristic nesting (zellballen) growth pattern is usually seen.  Other growth patterns including trabecular pattern may also be present.

Concepts.definition: Subjective reports made by a patient.

A neuroendocrine neoplasm of the sympathetic nervous system that arises from the chromaffin cells of the adrenal medulla and secretes catecholamines. Clinical presentation includes headaches, palpitations, chest and abdominal pain, hypertension, fever, and tremor.  Microscopically, a characteristic nesting (zellballen) growth pattern is usually seen.  Other growth patterns including trabecular pattern may also be present.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
